Little by little, her business grew, and she eagerly went to the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation to request a loan. After this, it grew even further. Today, she has received two loans which have increased her working capital, and through persistence and discipline she has managed to make improvements to her home and give her children an education. She has used her funding to increase the range of products she offers to her customers, in turn earning a larger profit. 

Today, her profit never falls below 22% and she rotates her stock every two days. Because of her dream of prosperity for this business entity, she is requesting a loan from Kiva to buy rice, oil, coffee and sugar in larger quantities, in order to get discounts. In addition, these are her best-selling products, and since it is the end-of-year period, when they are consumed in greater quantities due to Christmas and New Year, her investment will be very successful.

loans.use: to buy rice, oil, coffee and sugar in larger quantities.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.es: Gloria compró con su anterior credikiva víveres y abarrotes, como arroz, azúcar, aceite, plátano, artículos de aseo personal entre otros. Con este financiamiento logró mejorar el volumen de compras y tener inventarios de mercancías que más rotan en su negocio. Ella se siente muy satisfecha y por eso está recurriendo a un nuevo credikiva, con el cual hará en  las navidades y el año nuevo la mejor oferta del año  y con ello las mejores ventas como de costumbre en esta época por eso comparará ranchos, refrescos, bebidas, y víveres. . Ella envía un mensaje a sus financiadores de Kiva: “Mucha gracias por su colaboración, que Dios los bendiga hoy y siempre y que sigan ayudando a más personas”
texts.en: Gloria used her previous Kiva loan to buy food products and groceries such as rice, sugar, oil, bananas, toiletries, etc.  The loan allowed her to improve her purchasing power and she was able to have available more of the products that she sells the most of in her business.  She is very satisfied and, for this reason, is requesting another Kiva loan which will enable her to have a really good stock of products available to sell to her customers over the Christmas and New Year period.  This will ensure that she is able to sell more products as is usual at this time of year.  She will buy snacks, soft drinks and food products.  Gloria sends the following message to her Kiva lenders: "Many thanks for your cooperation.  I hope that God blesses you today and always and that you continue helping other people".

loans.use: to buy snacks, soft drinks and food products

loans.name: Al-Toufiq Group

texts.en: This group is called Al-Toufiq and consists of 3 women and man who live in Sana`a, Yemen.  They applied for a loan of 220,000 YER. Fatima is 34 years old and has been selling incense.  She applied for a loan of 60000 YER from AMB to buy incense for resale.

loans.use: to buy incense for resale.

loans.name: Faisl

texts.en: Faisl is a 39-year-old married man and father of two children who live in Sana`a, Yemen. He has a grocery store and has been involved in this business for one and a half years. He started his business with a small amount of capital. He is an incredibly hard-working man and as a result has a lot of experience. In addition, it is the only source of income for his family. He requested a loan of 150,000 YER from AMB in order to purchase grocery items for his business.

loans.use: to purchase grocery items for his business.

loans.name: Ahmed

texts.en:
Ahmed is a 37-year-old man, who lives in Taiz, Yemen.  He has a grocery store, from which he earns a low daily income and has been operating his business for one year.  He is hardworking man who works to cover the family's needs.  He intends to renew his house. 

Ahmed is requesting a loan of 150,000 YER from AMB to cover the cost of purchasing construction supplies in order to improve the living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to cover the cost of purchasing construction supplies in order to improve the living conditions of his family.

loans.name: Al-Mathny Group

texts.en:
This group is called Al-Mathny. It consists of 4 men who live in Sana'a, Yemen.

Salah is a 32-year-old, married man with 2 children. He is an employer at a mall. He has completed secondary school. 

He applied for a loan of 50,000 YER from AMB to buy home appliances and furniture.

loans.use: to buy home appliances and furniture.

loans.name: Enel

texts.es: Enel de 47 años se dedica a la venta de pescados, actividad que realiza tradicionalmente “porque sus padres así lo hicieron”. Enel todos los días desde de las 6 de la mañana hasta las 4 de la tarde trabaja vendiendo los famosos bocachicos, mojarra, pargo y jurel, que son sus principales productos y los compra en Poblaciones ubicadas a la orilla del rio, donde los empaca en cavas de icopor, con hielo, para su transporte. El mercado que aborda está conformado por  sus vecinos del barrio y los transeúntes que por allí recorren las calles. Su meta es aumentar el volumen de sus ventas pero su capital de trabajo no es suficiente para lograrlo, por eso acude a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará pescados que tiene encargado por familias, que se reúnen al final de año para celebrar las navidades y la llegada del año nuevo y consumen sancochos de ese productos que vende Enel,  para quitarse el malestar que les queda después de consumir licor y bailar toda la noche y esta es justamente la razón por la cual  su credikiva tendrá éxito, porque lo hace en el marco de su experiencia y de las solicitudes de su clientela a quien necesita complacer, para sostenerse en el mercado.
texts.en:
Enel, 47 years old, works selling fish, a traditional activity that he does “because his parents did so.”

Every day Enel works from 6:00 in the morning until 4:00 in the afternoon selling the renowned bocachicos, bream, snapper, and mackerel which are his main products. He buys them in towns located alongside the river, where he packs them in styrofoam with ice in order to transport them. He approaches the market formed by residents from his neighborhood and pedestrians who walk along the streets there.

His goal is to increase the volume of sales but his working capital is not sufficient to manage this, which is why he is asking for a Kiva loan, his first loan through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, so that he can buy fish that families have ordered for the end of the year to celebrate Christmas and the coming of the New Year by eating stew from the products Enel sells, in order to remove the discomfort that stays after drinking and dancing all night. This is why his Kiva loan will be successful, because he makes it within the frame of his experience and requests from his customers who he needs to please, to sustain himself in the marketplace.

loans.use: to buy fish to sell to his customers in order to celebrate their holiday activities.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: Maria de 46 años de edad, es la propietaria de una pequeña miscelánea donde ofrece variedades de mercancías, que sus clientes compran en un buen precio, pues ella en su experiencia de 10 años, conoce muy bien a sus proveedores y sabe hacer negociaciones de gano-ganas.  Los productos que más vende son bolsos, billeteras, gorros, correas, y artículos de consumo masivo. Su puesto de ventas está ubicado en un centro comercial,  al que llegan muchos visitantes, quienes son sus principales clientes. Las festividades de las navidades y el año nuevo, incrementan sus ventas y esto es bien conocido por Maria; por eso comprar de contado, a buen precio y en mayor volumen se convierte en uno de sus mayores desafíos, pues su propio capital, en esta época, no parece ser suficiente, para satisfacer la demanda del mercado. Esta es la razón por la cual acude a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará gafas, correas, billetera y bolsos. Con su credikiva Maria alcanzará el volumen de ventas que tiene en su mente como tradicionalmente lo hace y esto es justamente el éxito de su inversión.
texts.en:
Maria, age 46, has a small store where she sells a variety of merchandise that her customers buy at a good price.  She has ten years of experience, and she knows her providers very well.  She knows how to conduct win-win negotiations.

The products that sell the most are bags, wallets, caps, belts, and items of mass consumption.  The stand where she sells is located at a commercial center.  This is where many visitors arrive, and they are her main customers.  The Christmas and New Year’s holidays increase her sales.  Maria knows this very well, and that is why she buys for a good price in cash and in greater volume.

This becomes one of her greatest challenges.  At this time it appears that she does not have enough of her own capital to meet the market demand.  That is why she turns to a Kiva loan, her first loan with the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.  She will use the loan to buy glasses, belts, wallets, and bags.  With her Kiva loan Maria will reach the sales volume that she has in mind, like she usually does.  This is exactly the success of the investment.

loans.use: to buy glasses, belts, wallets, and bags.

loans.name: Rosalio

texts.es: Rosalío de 61 años es un hombre viudo padre de 6 hijos de 25 a 36 años de edad. Su experiencia en la preparación y venta de comidas,  data de hace 20 años, aunque solo desde hace 8, emprendió su propia aventura empresarial, con un préstamo que hizo a su padre, el cual fue su primer capital de trabajo. Desde eses momento ha desarrollado la tarea productiva en lo que más le gusta: la cocina. Su negocio ha cambiado la vida de su familia, porque ha generado ingresos para el sostén de su hogar y con su propio esfuerzo compra los insumos que utiliza para la preparación de alimentos y esto le genera autonomía. Su mayor desafío llega a final de cada año, cuando por efecto de las fiestas familiares de Navidad y año nuevo, los hogares consumen mucho más y su capital de trabajo no es suficiente para responder a la demanda planteada. Esta es la razón por la cual acude a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará arroz, aceite, y víveres en general, para hacer de estas navidades y recibir el año nuevo con su mejor venta del año y por supuesto con una muy buena utilidad.
texts.en:
Rosalío is 61 years old.  He is a widow and the father of six children between the ages of 25 and 36.  He has twenty years experience in preparing and selling food.  

Rosalío set up his own business eight years ago with a loan that he received from his father which was his first lot of working capital.  In the years since then, he has worked hard to improve his skills in what he enjoys most: cooking.  His business has changed his family's life because it has made him the income he needs to support his household.  Rosalío has worked hard to be able to afford the ingredients that he uses in preparing his food and this has given him independence.  His biggest challenge comes at the end of each year.  Owing to the numerous family parties that take place over the Christmas and New Year period, households consume a lot more than normal and Rosalío's working capital is not high enough to respond to the demand he experiences.  For this reason, he is applying for a Kiva loan (his first loan from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo).  He will buy rice, oil and other food products so that he will experience very good sales over the Christmas and New Year period.  He also hopes to make very good profits.

loans.use: to buy rice, oil and other food products

loans.name: Aref

texts.en:
Aref is a 37-year-old married man.  He has five children and lives in Taiz, Yemen. Aref has completed his university studies.

Aref has owned a taxi for many years. He collected money from another business that he owned and he had some gold which he sold and he borrowed a small amount of money from his brother in order to buy his taxi. Aref applied for a loan of 100,000 YER from AMB to buy spare parts for repairing his taxi.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for repairing his taxi.

loans.name: Al-Anod Group

texts.en: This group is called Al-Anod which consists of four women who live in Sana`a, Yemen. Lutfia is a 50-year-old married woman with five adult children. She has been selling clothes for five years. Lutfia is a responsible woman who works hard to gain daily income. Her business is not going well due to a lack of money. To expand her business she has applied for a loan of 50,000 YER from AMB to buy clothes for resale. She hopes to open a clothing store.

loans.use: to buy clothes for resale.

loans.name: Fola Group

texts.en: This is the Fola group which consists of 6 ladies who live in Taiz, Yemen. They applied for a loan of 180000 YER from AMB. Suria is 34 years old and married woman with 5 children. She works for the Municipality and gets low salary. She owns a small house. She applied for a loan of 30000 YER from AMB to buy construction supplies for her house. She hopes to improve her living standards.

loans.use: to buy construction supplies for her house.

loans.name: Agua Dulce Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “AGUA DULCE”  iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Santiago II, está compuesta por siete integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Elsa es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de ropa, venta de artefactos, chapería, elaboración de legía, producción y venta de videos, tejido de busos, venta de comida.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Elsa es integrante, ella indica que es el primer ciclo que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una promotora de la institución que le fue a visitar a su casa. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de comida, negocio lo implemento de hace años atrás con el apoyo de su hija.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de mesas y vajillas) que adquirirá de las tiendas que venden por mayor y posteriormente lo implementará en su espacio e comercialización. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para el sustento de su familia, ya que ella es casada y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las capacitaciones, el área de salud y el crédito.
texts.en:
Agua Dulce Communal Bank will start its first loan cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Santiago II Regional Office.  It's made up of seven members and governed by a board of directors of which Elsa is the president.  The businesses carried out by the bank members are varied and include clothing sales, craft sales, auto body repair, bleach production, video production and sales, making tracksuits, and food sales.

The loan they're going to get will benefit micro-enterprises of which Elsa's a member.  She indicates that it's the first cycle that she's a member of Pro Mujer, having joined on the invitation of a consultant of the institution who visited her at her house.  Currently she has a business selling food that she set up years ago with her daughter's help.

The loan she's going to get is to increase capital to purchase tables and dinnerware, which she'll buy from the stores that sell wholesale, to use in her business space.  This job allows her to generate resources to support her family because she's married and has two children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she says she likes the trainings, the health field, and the loan.

loans.use: to buy tables and dinnerware

loans.name: Al-Taisir Group

texts.en:
This group is called Al-Taisir.  It consists of four ladies who live in Sana`a, Yemen. They have applied for a loan of 180,000 YER. 

Nadia is 33 years old and married.   She has one child who lives in Sana`a.  She is a helpful woman who works with henna and khodab (black liquid) as a stylist for brides.  She has applied for a loan of 50,000 YER from AMB to buy henna and khodab (black liquid) for her business.

loans.use: to buy henna and khodab (black liquid) for her business.

loans.name: Al-Hadil Group

texts.en:
This group is called Al-Hadil.  It consists of four ladies who live in Hodeidah, Yemen. 

Khadra is 36 years old and single.  She lives in Hodeidah.  She is the breadwinner for her brothers and sisters after her parents passed away.  She sells icecream.  She has been able to attract many clients and she intends to expand her business.  She has applied for a loan of 60,000 YER from AMB to buy a fridge for her business.

loans.use: to buy a fridge for her business.

loans.name: Emzar

texts.en:
Emzar is 45 years old and from a small village of Akhaltsikhe district. He lives with his wife and three sons. Emzar works locally as a welder in a private company and gets a monthly income. 

The family is involved in agricultural activities. In particular, they have a milk cow, whose milk is used in dairy products. They sell dairy products locally in an open market at a good price. 

Emzar is a very hardworking man and has a rich experience in his business. He requested a loan for purchasing calves. After purchasing the calves, he will be able to expand the number of cattle. This will increase the income of the family. With increased income, the family will improve their living conditions. 

Emzar awaits your support.

loans.use: to purchase calves.

loans.name: María Delmy

texts.es:
Maria tiene 42 años de edad, es casada y tiene dos hijos. Ella es ama de casa y también se dedica al comercio de mariscos. Antes de comercializar con mariscos, María se dedicaba a lavar y planchar de personas que pagan por esos servicios. Gracias a una amiga que se dedicaba a esa actividad, ella aprendió y hoy ya tiene cuatro años de realizarlo, vende pescado y camarones. Para comprar el marisco le toma seis horas el viaje ya que debe abordar tres medios de transporte. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar más mariscos y para pagar a una persona que le ayude a venderlo. Con la inversión María tendrá disponible dinero para comprar suficientes marisco para satisfacer a sus clientes y obtener ingresos suficientes para comprar una yunta de bueyes para que su esposo y sus hijos cultiven los granos básicos. Además, desea que su negocio de venta de marisco incremente.
texts.en:
Maria is 42, married and has two children.  She is a housewife and also works selling seafood.  Before selling seafood, Maria washed and ironed clothes for other people who paid for her services.  Thanks to a friend that worked in this activity, she learned and now has been selling seafood for four years, she sells fish and shrimp.  To buy the seafood her trip takes six hours because she has to use three different trips.

The loan requested to Fundacion Campo, is to buy more seafood and to pay someone to help her sell it.  With the investment Maria will have money available to buy enough seafood to supply her clients and obtain enough income to buy some cattle for her husband and for her children to farm basic grains.  Also, she wants her seafood business to expand.

loans.use: to buy seafood and pay someone to help her sell it.

loans.name: Al-Safany Group

texts.en: This group is called Al-Safany, and it consists of 3 ladies and man who live in Sana`a, Yemen. Jamila is a 58-year-old married woman with children who live in Sana`a, Yemen. She applied for a loan of 30,000 YER from AMB to buy a vacuum cleaner for her house.

loans.use: to buy a vacuum cleaner for her house.

loans.name: Al-Najm Group

texts.en: This group is called Al-Najm, and it consists of 4 ladies who live in Taiz, Yemen. Latifa, 42, is a married woman who has four children in school. She lives in Taiz, Yemen. She has been selling ice cream for a few years. She is a responsible woman who works hard to provide for her family. She has a few clients and she intends to expand her business, so she applied for a loan of 30,000 YER from AMB to buy a refrigerator for her business.

loans.use: to buy a refrigerator for her business.

loans.name: Toma

texts.en:
Toma is 53 years old. He lives with his wife and two sons in the small village of Adigeni district. The family runs an agricultural business. In particular, they have four milk cows and two calves, whose milk is used in dairy products. In addition, they have a plot of land where different kinds of vegetables are grown. They sell the harvested vegetables and dairy products locally, in an open market, at a good price. 

Toma is a very hard-working man and has rich experience in his business. Toma requested a loan to purchase agricultural land. After purchasing additional land, he will be able to sow more vegetables. This will increase the income of the family. With increased income, they will improve their living conditions. Toma awaits your support.

loans.use: to purchase agricultural land.

loans.name: Apunba Chanura Group

texts.en:
This is Apunba Chanura Group consisting of 10 members. These hard working Meitei women belong to a non-tribal community. They come together to support one another and live in a small village on the outskirts of Imphal East in Manipur state, which is in the Northeastern part of India.
 
Premeshori is the profiled member pictured with her hand raised. She is 30 years old and is a mother to three daughters and two sons. Her husband is a hired carpenter by profession. The three older children go to a private school nearby. In order to supplement the family income before the loan, she earned an income by weaving Manipuri traditional clothes for others. She was paid for weaving only.
 
With her first loan in 2010, she continued her weaving activities by buying yarn with the loan. She managed to earn just enough profit to repay her loan liability. With competition in the market, she could not keep up with the challenges. With her second loan, the group members decided and agreed upon joint and common activities for profit motives. The group decided upon sand sieving (Quarrying) from the riverbed. They invested the loan of INR 80,000 to buy a permit for a portion of the riverbed to extract sand use for construction. The remaining INR 20,000 was shared equally among the members for their personal use. All the members work together at their owned site. The sale proceeds were shared equally by all the members. Sometimes the group was able to share the profit daily or on alternate days, depending on the business. From this share of profit, Premeshori bought two piglets to raise for her own. Furthermore, she invested INR 100 daily towards the group saving and another INR 500 on monthly savings managed by local investors. In this way, she means to do well for the family and supplement the family income.

Likewise, the rest of the group members too undertook different activities to supplement their income apart from the joint activity of sand sieving business. Small it may be, but with the profit, some members started poultry farming, raising ducks, running a paan corner, buying yarns for others to weave and so on.

Now the group needs another loan to continue with their sand sieving business. The loan will be use to buy another permit for a portion of the river bed to extract sand to sell.

loans.use: to buy another permit for a portion of the riverbed to extract sand to sell.

loans.name: Bahrom

texts.ru:
Бахром житель Шахритуского района. Ему 21 год. Он холост. Живет с родителями. Его отец находится на заработках за рубежом. Бахром имеет среднее образование. 
Бахром занимается растениеводством. Он выращивает овощи и бахчевые культуры для продажи. Таким образом Бахром зарабатывает и помогает своим родителям. 
Бахром берет кредит для посева овощей.
texts.en:
Bahrom lives in Shahrituz. He is 21 years old, single, and lives with his parents. His father works abroad. Bahrom has a secondary education. 

Bahrom farms. He grows vegetables and melons for sale. Bahrom earns money and thereby helps his parents. 

Bahrom is taking out a loan to plant vegetables.

loans.use: plant vegetables.

loans.name: Al-Batool Group

texts.en:
This group is called Al-Batool, which consists of 5 ladies who live in Sana'a, Yemen. 

Muna is 31 years old, married, and has one child who lives in Sana'a. She owns a small house and intends to renew her house. She applied for a loan of 70,000 YER from AMB to buy construction supplies to use for the house.

loans.use: to buy construction supplies to use to renew her house.

loans.name: Luxmi Group

texts.en:
This is Luxmi group. It was formed in 2010 and consists of five members. These hard working women belong to the Meitei community. They live in a small village on the outskirts of Imphal East located in the state of Manipur in the Northeastern part of India.

Memcha is the profile member pictured with her hand raised. She is 31 years old and is a mother to two sons and a daughter. She lives with her children and husband who is a carpenter by profession but usually earns income for the family on a seasonal basis. All the children attended a private school nearby. Before taking a loan, she did weaving activities part-time. At the same time, she did sand sieving activities from time to time. 

In 2010, with her first loan, she opened a small shop to earn income. She sells paan, cigarettes, soap, toy guns and eatables. With the second loan the following year, she expanded her shop by bringing in more new items to sell. With the help of her husband, she also started to sell fresh vegetables and included more grocery items such as oil, spices locally found, grain, potatoes, sugar, milk powder, chili, dry fish, dal etc. With the profit, she managed to repay her loan liability. She contributed INR 100 to the group savings on a monthly basis. Moreover, in order to save more, she joined a group of investors managed locally and invested INR 500 monthly. With the delay in loan disbursement by WSDS for the third phase, she used these savings to continue her business. She and her husband plan to re-establish her husband's carpentry business. She has been working very hard to sustain the family and providing education to her children is her only goal.

Now she needs another loan to continue with her supplementary income activities. She will use the loan to increase her stock to sell at her store to earn profits. She also wishes to use part of her loan to help her husband to start his carpentry activities. 

Likewise, the rest of the group members too needed another loan to improve their respective income-generating activities. Tea hotel business, retailing traditional weaved products, and sand sieving are the activities the group members are engaged in.

loans.use: To purchase more store stock

loans.name: Diana Group

texts.en:
These 12 hard-working women belong to a Tribal community. In 2010 they formed a group and called themselves the “Diana Group”. They all live in a small remote town called Saikul which is in the state of Manipur in the North Eastern part of India. It is about 70 km in distance from the main capital, Imphal.

Themneo, one of the 12 members, is pictured with raised hand. She is 28 years old and is a mother to two sons and one daughter. All her children go to a private school in the town. Her husband is a cultivator by profession and the breadearner of the family. She helped her husband cultivating rice on leased land. That could never sustain them from buying rice while waiting for the next harvest, because the share of the harvest is one-third of the produce, which is  to say that the owner of the paddy field gets double the share of the cultivator. In order to supplement the family income, Themneo decided to start weaving, the only activity she is good at. In fact, she started weaving at the early age of 16.

With her first loan she bought yarns and started her weaving activities. She wove traditional shawls called “Saipikhup” and wrap-round skirts called “Khamtang” and it takes about 6 days to finish  each respectively.  During the cultivation seasons she would schedule her time: three days for weaving and helping her husband in the field for two days. She actually made more progress with her business than she had imagined. Without much effort she was able to repay her loan and save money for household maintenance. Now, in order to expand her weaving activities, she apprentices her weaving skill by employing two learners. She has plans to create her own designs and start a weaving school in the long run.

Themneo has short-term and long-term goals to mention. In order to do her weaving full time she aims to enroll her children in a boarding school so that it will be a win-win situation for her children as well as her business. Her long-term goal is to purchase a paddy field big enough to sustain them for the whole year round.

Now she needs another loan to expand her weaving activities. Having employed two more weavers, she means to use the loan to buy yarns of different colours to weave and sell the finished products for a good price. She also will need money for buying clothing for her three children.

loans.use: to buy yarns of different colours to weave and sell as finished products for a good price.

loans.name: Toirjon

texts.ru:
Тоиржон проживает в городе Истаравшан. Ему 45 лет. Он женат. У него четверо детей. Тоиржон вместе с женой занимается животноводством. Он разводит скот у себя дома. Тоиржон разводит крупнорогатый скот. Этим видом деятельности он занимается десять лет. 
Тоиржон берет кредит для закупа быков и коров.
texts.en: Toirjon lives in Istaravshan town. He is 45 years old. He is married and has four children. Toirjon and his wife are involved in animal husbandry. He has been breeding large cattle at home for ten years now. Toirjon is taking out a loan to purchase bulls and cows.

loans.use: buy bulls and cows

loans.name: Shahriniso

texts.ru: Шахринисо проживает в городе Турсунзаде. Она вдова. У нее трое детей. Шахринисо на протяжении десяти лет занимается торговлей. На сегодняшний день у нее магазин со смешанным ассортиментом товара. Шахринисо берет кредит для покупки тканей с целью увеличения оборота и ассортимента товара.
texts.en: Shahriniso lives in Tursun-zoda. She is a widow with three children. Shahriniso has over ten years of experience in trade. Currently, she owns a store that sells various goods. Shahriniso is taking out a loan to buy fabric so that she can increase sales and have a more varied product mix.

loans.use: to buy fabric

loans.name: Gyenvudde Women's Group

texts.en:
Mariam, Juliet, Teo, Milly, Josephine, Aisha and Patience

Gyenvudde Women’s Group is a women-dominated group located in the center of Kalisizo Town. The group is comprised of women whose major activity is charcoal selling. They are mainly single mothers.

Teo is a married and hardworking lady with three children ages 2, 3, and 12 years, of whom one goes to school. She also takes care of one other child - a nephew whose parents passed away.

Teo sells fresh fruits and vegetables, which include tomatoes, beans, Irish potatoes, onions, oranges, cabbages, etc. She supplements her business by selling fish and she works for seven days a week.

After trying out several activities, Teo finally concentrated on the fresh fruit selling business, which seemed more profitable. That was in 2001. She diversified this business with fish selling. She will use the loan to boast up her fish selling business.

The major challenge she faces is the rotting of the fruits and vegetables. This comes from the period where there is low customer turn-over and the fact that she has no refrigerator to keep the fruits and vegetables fresh.

With the help of the loan, Teo hopes to buy a plot and build a house of her own in the near future.

loans.use: to buy fish to sell.

loans.name: Faiz

texts.en:
Faiz is very trustworthy, responsible, and a hard worker. He has many clients. He is 46 years old and lives in Sana'a, Yemen. He has 4 children.

He has been operating a business of sports clothing sales for over three years. He collected money to open his business. He works very hard to improve the future for his children and he is always looking for ways to provide new and better services to his customers. 

He completed his university degree and now he has requested a loan of 200,000 YER from AMB, which he will use to buy sports clothes for his business so that he can provide his customers with a wider selection and better quality products.

loans.use: to buy sports clothes for his business.

loans.name: Panthoibi Group

texts.en:
In 2010, these five hard-working Meitei women formed a group called “Panthoibi”. They live in a small village at the outskirts of Imphal East in the state of Manipur which is in the North Eastern part of India. In order to supplement their family incomes, they came together as a group to help one another to access loans.

Pasot is the profiled member and is pictured with raised hand. She is 36 years old, a mother to three children, and lives with her husband, who is a workshop mechanic for two-wheeler vehicles. All her children go to a private school at the nearby town. She is very happy and determined to provide a good learning platform for her children. Before her loan she was a mere housewife. She just had to be content with the income that her husband brought home. With much persuasion, she talked her husband into letting her join a 5-member group to access loans.

With her first loan she partnered with one weaver for profit-sharing. She bought yarns for the weaver to weave. Then she would sell the woven traditional clothes at the main market. With her second loan she continued with the trade on a wider scale by purchasing finished products to increase her supply at the main market. With part of her loan she opened a small tea stall which was open in the morning till 9:00 am and in the afternoon from 3:00 pm to 5:00 pm, for her convenience. In her tea stall she serves only tea and 'puri'. As it turns out, she has been making better progress with her tea stall business than her other business. Eventually she began opening her tea stall for longer periods and it became her main source of income as well as for the family because her husband began helping at the tea stall. It has been quite some time now that her husband quit the mechanic work and engaged in the tea stall/catering business.

Now Pasot needs another loan to continue with her tea stall. She wishes to upgrade her tea stall with better arrangements for the customers to sit down. She also wishes to find a replacement for her husband. She means that her husband should continue with his mechanic's skill to increase the family income.

Likewise, the rest of her group members too need a loan to do better with their respective businesses.

loans.use: to buy more tables and benches to expand her tea stall.

loans.name: Mukama Yemubeezi Kisunku Group

texts.en:
The Mukama ye Mubeezi Kisunku Group is located at the outskirts of Kalisizo town and its members are mostly farmers. Group members are Charles, Vincent, Rose, Dinah, Margret, Josephine, Teddy, Rose and Cate. The staff member from Ugafode is the tenth person on the right in this picture.

Cate started her business running a local brewery and rearing pigs in 1990. She brews once a week. Cate began her business to earn school fees for her children because she could not wholly depend on her husband. Her clients are individuals and retailers in her home village. Cate's business challenges include lack of capital, scarce firewood and labor, and poor access to markets.

Cate is requesting a loan to buy more drums, pipes, funnels and jerrycans for her local brew business.

loans.use: to buy drums, pipes, funnels and jerrycans for her local brew business

loans.name: Abdurahmon

texts.ru:
Абдурахмон проживает в районе Шахритус. Ему 41 года. Он женат. Абдурахмон является отцом семерых детей. Жена Абдурахмон занимается растениеводством. Его сын студент. Он учится в Таджикском национальном Университете города Кургантюбе. 
Абдурахмон зарабатывает путем разведения крупнорогатого скота. Этим видом деятельности он занимается у себя дома. Абдурахмон берет кредит для закупа мелко - рогатого и крупнорогатого скота.
texts.en:
Abdurahmon lives in Shahrituz. He is 41 years old, married and has seven children. Abdurahmon's wife farms.  His son is a student studying at the Tajik National University in Kurgan-Tube. 

Abdurahmon makes a living breeding cattle. He does this at home. Abdurahmon is taking out a loan to buy various livestock.

loans.use: to buy cows, calves, and goats.

loans.name: George William

texts.en:
George William is a peasant aged 49 years. He is married with five children, and he and his wife live in rural Western Uganda. His major occupation is cattle rearing, while his wife tills land for them to put food for their family on the table as well as provide other basic needs. 

His major challenge has been difficulty in finding tuition for his children. He hopes when the number of cows increase, his income will rise, and he will be able to meet the school tuition in time.

loans.use: To buy cows for selling.

loans.name: Azra

texts.en:
Ms Azra is 40 years old and a married woman. She has been running a general store for the past eleven months. Her husband and son also assist her in her business. Her store is located in a corner of her house where she sells various items and goods for everyday use. She has become famous in her community and has retained many regular customers. 

Ms Azra is very motivated to provide for her family. She wants to grow her business, so she has requested a loan for 25000 PKR to buy rice, flour, and packets of oil in large quantities to meet with the growing demand of her customers. 

She wishes to spend the earned revenue on the providing quality education to her children.

loans.use: to buy rice, flour, and packets of oil in large quantities to meet with the growing demand of her customers.

loans.name: Perveen

texts.en:
Ms. Perveen is a 44-year-old married woman. She has been running a cloth trading business for many years at her home. She started her business with just a few cotton cloths and over time she has become famous in her community for providing good quality cloths. She offers various types of cloths including linen, silk and cotton.

Perveen is a responsible mother of seven children; she needs to provide them with the basic necessities of life. Three of her children are also working to contribute to the family income. In order to purchase more variety of cloth for the winter season, she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of 30,000 PKR. She expects a boost in her net income through her large sales. She wishes to spend part of her profits on the bright future of her children. Her children feel proud of their mother.

loans.use: to purchase more variety of cloth for the winter season

loans.name: Ali

texts.en: Ali is 52 years old. He is married man and has four children who live in Taiz, Yemen. He lives in a rented house. He applied for a loan of 200,000 YER (Yemen rials) from AMB to buy furniture for the house. He hopes to own a house someday.

loans.use: to buy furniture for his rented house.

loans.name: Zeenut

texts.en:
Ms. Zeenut is a 45-year-old, vigorous married woman. She has had a business of machine embroidery for the past 20 years. She is passionate about her work, and client demand is strong. But business challenges, combined with family expenditures, frustrate her nearly every day. Her husband is employed in a factory, but he does not earn enough to support his family well. Zeenut’s stitching patterns are very popular on her street, and she is the best earning resource in her household. 

She is a mother of three children. She wants to grow her business. She requested a loan of Rs 30,000 from Kashf Foundation, to buy raw materials such spools of thread, sequins and zippers in large quantities to meet the increasing demand. She shared her dream of running a training center for girls of her village. She would teach stitching skills, so they can help her expand her business, and also earn money for themselves.

loans.use: to buy raw materials such spools of thread, sequins and zippers in large quantities to meet the increasing demand.

loans.name: Nusrat

texts.en:
Ms. Nusrat is a 49-year-old married woman. She has been running a goat-rearing business for many years. She started her business with the support of the Kashf Foundation. She is supporting her family of seven members. With the help of her husband, she is running a successful business to provide them with a decent life. 

Ms. Nusrat buys animals (baby goats) at low prices, raises them and then sells them at higher prices. Her husband also assists her in selling them in the market. She took a loan for the betterment of her business and to increase her livestock, i.e., goats. Now she is requesting PKR 40,000 for the purchase of eight more goats. She has been in association with the Kashf Foundation for six years. She hopes to grow her business and dreams of giving a high-quality education to her children through all her hard work on her business.

loans.use: to purchase eight more goats.

loans.name: Shabana

texts.en:
Ms. Shabana is a 41-year-old married woman. She is the mother of three children, two sons and one daughter.  She is trying hard to fulfill their demands, including food, health, clothing, and education. 

Shabana has been doing a business of manufacturing “waan”. (Waan is a material used in making charpoy, a bedstead of woven webbing or hemp stretched on a wooden frame on four legs, common in Pakistan). Her husband assists her by purchasing scrap cloth from the market, and after manufacturing waan, sells it in the local market as well as in the nearest cities.  Ms. Shabana operates the waan machine at home with the help of her husband. They are contentedly doing this for the sake of their family. 

Shabana offers various kinds of waan in different colors and is famous in providing a good-quality product in her community. She requires improving her business, so she applied for a loan of Rs. 30,000 to buy another waan-making machine. 

Shabana wishes to spend part of the profits on the betterment of her family members.

loans.use: to buy another waan-making machine to improve the quality of her product.

loans.name: Shahnaz

texts.en:
Ms. Shahnaz is a 36-year-old married woman.  She has been successfully running a small general store in her community for the last four years. She offers various goods for daily use. She has good communication skills and counts on a good client list. She and her husband are jointly running this business.

Shahnaz is the mother of three children. She is motivated to provide for her family. As she wants to grow her business, she requested a loan of Rs 35,000 to buy stock of rice and flour from the market at lower rates. She then would be able to meet the increasing demand consistently. 

Shahnaz is in her third loan cycle and has shown excellent repayment behavior. She wishes to utilize part of revenues to deal with personal expenses and to increase business capital. She also shares her dream of providing quality education to her children.

loans.use: to buy stock of rice and flour from the market at lower rates.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy pickle making ingredients for pickle making and selling business

loans.name: Zubaida

texts.en: Ms. Zubaida is a hard-working lady who is very eager to work to support her family. She started her sewing business one year ago, with the support of Kashf Foundation. Her husband also helps her by purchasing raw materials for sewing. Ms. Zubaida needs a loan of 15000 PKR to purchase raw materials, such as spools of thread and packs of buttons, laces and zippers in various colors. In this way, she would be able to supply her customers on time, which ultimately helps to bring in more cash. She wishes to spend part of her profit on the expansion of her business.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials, such as spools of thread and packs of buttons, laces and zippers in various colors, for her business.

loans.name: Al-Hana Group

texts.en:
This group is called Al-Hana and it consists of six ladies who live in Sana`a, Yemen. Safa is 24 years old and sells incense. 

Safa is requesting a 300,000 YER youth loan to buy construction supplies.

loans.use: to buy construction supplies

loans.name: Naseem

texts.en:
Naseem is a 31-year-old married woman with three children, two of whom attend school. Her husband appears in this photo with her. Naseem's husband uses his bicycle to sell different goods such as toys, balloons, and other items in nearby communities. He makes enough to bear the expenses of the family members.

Naseem is requesting a 35,000 PKR loan to purchase a motorcycle to improve her husband's business. This will be her fifth loan cycle with the Kashf foundation and she has a strong association with them. Naseem will use part of the income from her loan to provide a good education for her children.

loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle.

loans.name: Tajan

texts.en:
Ms. Tajan is a 46-year-old married woman. She has been doing fodder work for the last 2 years, with the support of her husband. The man shown in the photo is Tajan’s husband. Ms. Tajan sells fodder (feed) for animals from home while her husband delivers it to the required places. Tajan has taken several loans for the expansion of her family's business of fodder work.  

Currently she requested a loan of 30,000 PKR to purchase a donkey cart to deliver fodder to customers' places. In this way, her husband would be able to increase his sales in less time, which ultimately helps bring in more cash. She has three children; all are going to school. She wants to give a fruitful environment to her children for their better growth in society.

loans.use: to purchase a donkey cart to deliver fodder to customers' places

loans.name: Abida

texts.en:
Ms Abida is a 40-year-old, vigorous, married woman. She has been doing a business of hand embroidery for the past twelve years. She is passionate about her work and client demand is strong, but business challenges, combined with family expenditures, frustrate her nearly every day. Her husband is a labor person, but he does not earn enough to support his family well. This compelled her to initiate her own business to contribute in the family income. 

She is a mother of seven children. She wants to grow her business, so she requested a loan of 20,000 PKR to buy raw materials such as threads, sequins, and pearls in large quantities to meet with the increasing demand. 

She dreams of running a boutique center in her street, so then she would be able to display her patterns and designs.

loans.use: to buy raw materials such as threads, sequins, and pearls in large quantities to meet her increasing demand.

loans.name: Parveen

texts.en:
Ms. Parveen is a 51-year-old married woman. She has been successfully running a small general store in her community for the last four years. She offers various goods for daily use. She has good communication skills and counts on a good client list. Her husband is also running this general store with her. 

She is a mother of three children. She is motivated to provide for her family. As she wants to grow her business, she requested a loan of 20,000 PKR to buy stock of rice and flour from the market at lower rates. She then would be able to meet the increasing demand consistently. She is in her 2nd loan cycle and has shown excellent repayment behavior. She wishes to utilize part of her revenues to deal with personal expenses and to increase business capital.

loans.use: to buy stock of rice and flour from the market at lower rates

loans.name: Shumaila

texts.en:
Ms. Shumaila is a 27-year-old lady. She has been doing stitching for many years.  By now, she has become famous in her community and has retained many regular customers. She is eager to support her family and makes enough to contribute to the family income. 

So as to complete orders on time, she applied for a loan of Rs. 20,000 to Kashf Foundation to purchase spools of thread with the packs of buttons, lace and needles. In this way she would be able to cater for customers’ orders without fail. She wishes to expand her business in near future to improve the standard of living of her family members.

loans.use: to purchase spools of thread with packs of buttons, lace and needles.

loans.name: Saiqa

texts.en:
Ms. Saiqa is 27 years old and unmarried. She has five siblings; she is the elder among them. Her father is a junior-level government employee with a low salary and his income is insufficient for their family expenditures. To meet her household’s expenditures and provide a bright future for her siblings, Saiqa decided to start a sewing business in her home. She stitches for the people in her communty and uses the income to support her entire family. 

However, due to a lack of availability of funds, Saiqa is unable to meet the daily demands of her customers. She is currently in her second loan cycle and has borrowed PKR 15,000 from the Kashf Foundation. She intends to use this loan amount to buy raw materials, including spools of thread, packs of lace, buttons and zippers in various colors. This will help her meet her customers’ demands consistently, which will ultimately help her earn more cash to bring home.

loans.use: to buy raw materials, including spools of thread, packs of lace, buttons and zippers in various colors.

loans.name: Samina

texts.en:
Mrs. Samina is a 54-year-old married woman. She has run a tailoring business for the past 10 years. She is an expert at stitching stylish dresses for women. She has two children. They are all studying at the higher education level. Her husband's income is not sufficient enough to provide all the necessities for her family. She stitches for the people in her community and uses the income to support her entire family. 

However, due to a lack of availability of funds, Samina is unable to meet the daily demands of her customers. Therefore she contacted the Kashf Foundation and has applied for a loan of PKR 20,000. This loan will help her to purchase more spools of thread, laces and zippers in different colors. She dreams of providing a quality education for her children.

loans.use: to purchase more spools of thread, laces and zippers in different colors.

loans.name: Marjorie

texts.es: Marjorie, tiene la edad  de 47 años, está en casada, vive con sus hijos, los cuales son su mayor prioridad. Con su crédito pretende hacer la reparación en una parte de la casa para evitar que el deterioro y darle un poco de más seguridad. Lo que pretende es aprovechar  las ofertas que brinda el comercio en estas tiempos de fin de año y que son de buena calidad. Con las mejoras que pretende hacer quiere evitar el deterioro de pertenencias y así tener un poco de ahorro para el mejor bienestar de su familia y pasar este Diciembre con más tranquilidad y comenzar el 2013 con mejores condiciones de vida y positivismo. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. No había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en: Marjorie, age 47, is married and lives with her children, who are her priority.  With the loan she plans to repair part of her house to avoid damage and make it more safe.  She wants to take advantage of the sales that are offered by the retailers during this end of year sales that are of good quality.  With the renovations that she hopes to make she wants to avoid any damage to her belongings and have more savings to improve the well-being of her family and spend this December with more tranquility and start 2013 with the best life conditions and optimism. This is the first loan with Fudecosur.  She's never had credits with state banks before, but Fudecosur has provided her with the loan with more facilities and at much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to make home renovations.

loans.name: Shakoori

texts.en:
Ms. Shakoori is a 55-year-old widow who has been in the hand embroidery business with her son for ten years. The man shown in the photo is Shakoori’s son. She started her business very small. She has maintained her business and attracted many customers, due to her courage and devotion.  

In order to improve her business productivity, she contacted a Kashf Foundation business development officer and thus was able to access quality micro-finance services, which have played a vital role in her business productivity. It has now grown to the desired level. Currently she is requesting a loan of 20000 PKR to purchase raw materials, such as packs of sequins, glittering material and spools of threads in various colors. She has been with Kashf for three years. She wishes to spend the part of her profits on the betterment of her family members.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials, such as packs of sequins, glittering material and some spools of thread in various colors, for her business.

loans.name: Fozia

texts.en: Ms. Fozia is 29-year-old married woman and a mother of two. She has been running a beauty parlor for the past seven months. She started her business at a very small level and has expanded it gradually. In order to fast-track her business growth, she contacted a Kashf Foundation business development officer and thus was able to access quality micro-finance services, which have played a vital role in the growth of her business. Now her business has grown to a satisfactory level. She needs a loan of 20000 PKR to purchase more products for hair treatment and skin polishers and cleansers to serve and retain more customers. She aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more products for hair treatment and skin polishers and cleansers to serve and retain more customers.

loans.name: Nasira

texts.en: Ms. Nasira is a 32-year-old lady and a mother of four. Her husband has been driving a rickshaw for the past two years.  The man shown in the photo is Nasira’s husband.  She has applied for a loan of 30000 PKR for the benefit of her husband, who wants to replace his auto rickshaw's body. This will help him operate his business better and permit him to offer improved transport services to his passengers. Nasira is positive that the new auto rickshaw body will reduce daily maintenance expenses and increase her husband's profitability. She has been with Kashf Foundation for four years and is very thankful to Kashf for its support.

loans.use: to replace the body of her husband's auto rickshaw.

loans.name: Saleem

texts.en:
Saleem is a 55-year-old married woman and the  mother of five. Her husband appears in this photo with her. For the past three years, Saleem has been running a general store with the support of her husband. She has become famous in her street for providing good quality products at reasonable prices. 

Saleem is requesting a 35,000 PKR loan through the Kashf Foundation to fully stock her store and purchase beverages, biscuits, rice, and sugar. This will be her third loan cycle and she has a good repayment history.  Saleem states that microfinance services have enabled her to improve the living standards of her family. Now she has better access to finances to provide the basic necessities of life and live a happy life with her family.

loans.use: to purchase beverages, biscuits, rice, and sugar

loans.name: Oscar

texts.es: Oscar, tiene la edad  de 39 años, está casado, vive con sus hijos y esposa  que son su mayor prioridad. Con su crédito pretende hacer la compra de madera de buena calidad y que serba para la fabricación de muebles, además hacer la compra de unas herramientas para la preparación de la madera y así darle un acabado adecuado y que los muebles sean de mejor calidad y con terminado atractivo para los clientes. Además con las ganancias que pueda obtener con la venta de la madera procesada seguir invirtiendo en más madera y equipo y mejorar las instalaciones del local de trabajo, también de poder pagar los estudios de sus hijos y hacer que su familia progrese más y tener un mejor nivel de vida para toda su familia.  Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Él no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Oscar, 39 years old, is married and lives with his wife and children. They are his biggest priority. With this loan, Oscar hopes to buy good quality wood to make furniture. Additionally, he will buy some tools necessary for preparing and finishing the wood in order to make better quality furniture pieces that customers find more attractive.

With the resulting earnings from selling finished wood products, Oscar will continue investing in more wood and equipment, as well as make some improvements to the building he works in. He hopes to be able to pay for his children's education and help his family progress and obtain a better quality of life.

This is Oscar's first loan with FUDECOSUR. Although he has never borrowed from any national banks, FUDECOSUR has offered him this loan with good terms and much lower interest rates.

loans.use: to buy better quality wood and equipment for preparation and finishing treatments.

loans.name: Tahira

texts.en:
Tahira is 31 years old and the mother of one. For the past year, she has been running a small general store from a corner of her house. Tahira happily runs her business to support her family members. She keeps her shop open for the maximum amount of hours to serve a maximum number of customers. Everyone in community goes to Tahira's shop as she makes things readily available every time.

Tahira is requesting a 20,000 PKR loan to buy stock of pulses, sugar, and cold drinks. She will use her loan to be able to cater to more customers time after time. Tahira hopes to spend the profits from her loan to provide a quality education for her child.

loans.use: to buy pulses, sugar, and cold drinks.

loans.name: Gulnaz

texts.en:
Gulnaz is a 26-year-old married woman and the mother of five. For the past two years, she has been running a sewing business from her home. Gulnaz had a difficult time after her husband's business failed and she decided to initiate her own business to support her family and provide a better future. She does stitching for the people living in her neighborhood and uses the income to support her entire family. 

Gulnaz is requesting a 20,000 PKR loan through the Kashf Foundation to buy raw materials including cloth, different colored thread, lace, zippers, and other items. Her loan will provide the funds to meet the demands of her customers. Gulnaz hopes that her loan will increase her revenue and provide a more secure source of income for her family.

loans.use: to buy cloth, colored thread, lace, zippers, and other items

loans.name: Angelica Del Rocio

texts.es:
Angelica tiene 47 años de edad de estado civil soltera tiene tres hijos vive con los hijos en el Recinto PAMPAS GRANDE perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas Provincia de Los Ríos. 

Pertenece a la Ventanilla AHORRANDO PARA EL FUTURO se encuentra ubicada el  recinto PAMPAS GRANDE, perteneciente al cantón Ventanas se dedica a labores agrícolas y pecuarias. 

Angelica se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y arroz. Con el crédito podrá comprar insumos como: fertilizantes, abonos, insecticidas para evitar las plagas y enfermedades. Las compras las realiza en la ciudad de Ventanas. El crédito le ayudado para aumentar los ingresos y los cultivos. 

El sueño comprar un terreno para construir una casa. En los tiempos libres le gusta hacer deporte y escuchar música.
texts.en:
Angélica, 47, is single and has three children. She lives with her children in the precinct of Pampas Grande in Ventanas Canton, Los Ríos Province. She belongs to Ahorrando para el Futuro Communal Bank in Pampas Grande in Ventanas, which works in agriculture and livestock.

Angélica makes a living in agriculture growing corn and rice. With the loan she'll be able to buy supplies such as fertilizer, manure, and insecticide to avoid pests and disease. She makes her purchases in the city of Ventanas. The loan has helped her increase her income and her crops.

Her dream is to buy a plot of land to build a house.  In her free time she likes to play sports and listen to music.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, manure, and insecticide

loans.name: Magno Nisson

texts.es:
Magno tiene 32 años de edad de estado civil soltero no tiene hijos vive con los padres en el Recinto PAMPAS GRANDE perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas Provincia de Los Ríos. 

Pertenece a la Ventanilla AHORRANDO PARA EL FUTURO se encuentra ubicada el  recinto PAMPAS GRANDE, perteneciente al cantón Ventanas se dedica a labores agrícolas y pecuarias.

loans.name: Najib

texts.en:

Najib would like to expand his business, so he applied for a loan of 200,000 YER from AMB to buy vehicle wheels, batteries and oils for his business. 

He hopes to open many branches around the city.

loans.use: to buy vehicle wheels, batteries and oils for his business.

loans.name: Taramaya Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “TARAMAYA”  iniciará el tercer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Achacachi, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Martha es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de queso, venta de leche, albañiles, venta de verduras.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias con distintos rubros, donde la señora Martha es parte integrante, ella indica que hace dos años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una amiga que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de ganado, cuenta que hace años aprendió este negocio, heredándolo de sus padres.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de ganado) que adquirirá de las comunidades aledañas, por mayor,  y posteriormente a la crianza lo comercializará a pedido en la Ciudad de El Alto. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su hogar pues ella es casada y tiene cinco hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta los ahorros.
texts.en:
The communal bank “TARAMAYA”  will begin its third loan cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of Centro Focal de Achacachi. The group has eight members, and Martha is president of its board. The members work at various jobs including selling milk, cheese, and vegetables and bricklaying. The loan will benefit a variety of micro businesses such as Martha's. She says she joined Pro Mujer two years ago at the invitation of a friend who works for the institution. 

Martha sells livestock, a trade she learned from her parents and has been working at for years. She is applying for a working capital loan to buy livestock at wholesale in nearby communities to raise and later sell and fill orders in the city of El Alto. Her work allows her to earn income to support her household as best she can. She is married and has five children. She says that what she most likes about Pro Mujer is that she now saves money.

loans.use: to buy livestock.

loans.name: Raiat Al-Atfal Group

texts.en: This group is called Raiat Al-Atfal and consists of three men who live in Sana`a, Yemen. Qaed is 45 years old, a married man who lives in Sana`a. He is employed in a child-care organization. He has applied for a loan of 80,000 YER from AMB to buy a laptop to use in his work.

loans.name: Bienvenidos Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “BIENVENIDA”  iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Panamericana, está compuesta por siete integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Nelly es la Secretaria. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: tejido de mantas de vicuña, tejido de busos, venta de carne, venta de verduras, venta de chompas, venta de ropa para bebe.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Nelly es integrante, ella indica que es el primer ciclo que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una asesora de la institución que le fue a visitar a su casa. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de verduras, cuenta que este negocio fue de su madre hace sesenta y cuatro años atrás y ella lo sigue manejando como fuente de economía.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de verduras) que adquirirá de las negociantes al por mayor y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos económicos para su familia, ya que ella es soltera y tiene un hijo.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las capacitaciones del área de salud.
texts.en:
The "Bienvenida" communal bank will begin its first loan cycle with Pro Mujer, through the Panamericana regional office. It is made up of seven members, and is led by a board, of which Nelly is the secretary.

The businesses that the members of the communal bank carry on are varied, and include: weaving vicuña shawls, knitting sweaters, selling meat, selling vegetables, selling sweaters, and selling baby clothing. 

The loan they will take will benefit small business owners such as Nelly. She says this is her first loan cycle as a member of Pro Mujer. She joined at the invitation of a field advisor of the institution, who came to visit her at her home. Currently she has a business selling vegetables. She says that this business was her mother's 64 years ago, and she continues to run it as a livelihood. 

The loan she will now take out is for increasing her working capital through buying vegetables, which she will acquire from the wholesale merchants and later sell at her stall. This form of work allows her to generate financial resources for her family, as she is single and has a son. 

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she answers that she likes the health education.

loans.use: To buy vegetables.

loans.name: Los Pinos De Corazon Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “LOS PINOS DE CORAZON”  iniciará el tercer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Senkata, está compuesta por once integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Francisca es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de verduras, venta de pan, venta de comida, venta de gelatina, venta de awayos, venta de carne.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Francisca es integrante, ella indica que hace un año que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una promotora de la institución que fue a visitarla a su casa. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de comida, negocio que implemento hace varios años por iniciativa propia.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de verduras y cereales) que adquirirá de las ferias de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente a la preparación lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener en lo posible a su hogar pues ella es separada y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el consultorio médico y los ahorros.
texts.en:
The “Los Pinos De Corazon” communal bank is beginning its third cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Senkata center.  It’s made up of eleven members and directed by a board of directors where Francisca serves as the president.  The members have different businesses including: vegetable sales, bread sales, food sales, gelatin sales, awayos sales, and meat sales.

This loan will benefit small businesses where Francisca is a member and she says that she has been with Pro Mujer for a year, having joined after a promoter visited her home.  She sells food and began several years ago on her own initiative.
 
This loan will help her buy vegetables and cereals that she will buy at fairs in El Alto and then sell them in her stall.  This type of work allows her to generate income to maintain her household.  She is separated and has three children.
 
When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she says that she likes the health and financial training.

loans.use: to buy fruits and cereals.

loans.name: Ama Chuma Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “AMA CHUMA”  iniciará el segundo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Alto Lima, está compuesta por nueve integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Marleny es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: artesana en cartapacios, venta de choclos, venta de verduras, costura de bermudas y chamarras, macramé de mantas, costura de mandiles, venta de salchipapas.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Marleny es integrante, ella indica que es hace seis meses que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una promotora de la institución que le fue a visitar a su casa. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de salchipapas (comida), este negocio lo implemento por necesidad, ya que había concluido su trabajo en una empresa decidiendo ser independiente con la implementación de este negocio.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de papas por mayor) que adquirirá de los carros provinciales y posteriormente a la preparación lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para su familia, pues ella es casada y tiene cinco hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las capacitaciones del área de salud y crédito.

En la fotografía no esta la Señora Mery ya que entro a consulta médica.
texts.en:
The group "Ama Chuma" will start their second cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the Focus Centre of Alto Lima, it is formed by nine members and directed by a board where Marleny is the President.

The businesses that they work on vary, amongst them are: crafts, shoe sales, vegetable sales, tailoring shorts and jackets, fabric crafts, making of aprons, hot dog and fries sales.

The loan that they will take out will benefit the micro-enterprises that Marleny is part of, she indicated that six months ago she joined Pro Mujer, she joined because a promoter from the institution invited her to her home.  She currently has a food business selling hot dogs and fries, this business was started because of need, her job at a company had ended and she decided to become independent by implementing this business.

The loan will be used for working capital (to buy potatoes at wholesale) she will buy them, make them and sell later on.  This working system allows her to generate income for her family, she is married and has five children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she answers that she likes the training they get on health and credit topics.

Mery is not in the photograph as she was in a medical appointment at the time.

loans.use: to buy potatoes at wholesale prices.
